segments.text: I notice the water is just pouring out of the sink, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is drying dishes like nothing is wrong—how can she not see this?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor is getting ruined, and she’s just standing there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are making things worse by climbing on that stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how messy this whole situation is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to cause so much damage, and she’s not even reacting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the boy is going to fall any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for cookies, completely ignoring the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is a mess, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t stand watching this—someone needs to fix it.
segments.speaker: PAR
